title: full?
description: Write a function `full?` that takes a binary search tree and returns true if the tree is full (every node has either 0 or 2 children), and false otherwise.

examples.explanation: An empty tree is considered full
A single node tree is full
All nodes have either 0 or 2 children

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (full? t))

(full? empty)
(full? (make-node empty empty 5))
(full? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
(full? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) empty 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (full? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) true)
(check-expect (full? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) false)
(check-expect (full? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) empty 10)) false)
(check-expect (full? (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) false)
